displace.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to take the place or position of something or someone
displace.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
displace.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make a group of people or animals have to leave the place where they normally live
displace.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Fifty thousand people have been displaced by the fighting.
displace.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to force something out of its usual place or position
displace.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The water displaced by the landslides created a tidal wave.
